intro: Omphacomeria acerba, commonly known as the slender leaved shrub, is a species of flowering plant in the family Scrophulariaceae. It is native to the eastern United States, particularly found in the Appalachian region. The plant typically grows as a low, compact shrub with small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, appearing in clusters and blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or stream banks.
